children.title: Create a filler screen for a Reports view with no data.

children.description:
No data view will appear when there are no items created.

It will not appear when a customer filters the page and no results match the filter. This will use the existing "no items match your filters" view.

- Onboarding -> Reports.
- If no items exist, show no data view.

description:
The new flow needs to include the following:

* If the item is unassigned, show "This item is unassigned. Assign to [user drop down]."
* Admins will see "[assignee] hasn't started work on this yet. Reassign to [user drop down]." while it is in the backlog.
* Once the item is assigned the assignee will see "You have not started working on this item. [start button]".
* When the assignee clicks the [start button], they will then see "You started working on this X days ago. [finish]".
* When the item is in progress everyone else will see "[assignee] is hard at work making magic happen."
* Admins will see "[assignee] started working on this X days ago. Reassign to [user drop down]".
* When the assignee clicks [finish] they, and non-admins, will see "This item is currently awaiting acceptance."
* Admins will see "[assignee] finished this item X days ago. [accept] or [reject]".
* Clicking on accept moves the item to accepted.
* Clicking reject will pop up a small text box so that the person rejecting can give a reason as to why.

description:
Customer Sean from bit.ly reports that sub-items do not show up in the Timeline view.

1. Log in as [sean@bit.ly](https://sprint.ly/admin/auth/user/17068/"django")

2. Go to Timelines view

3. Check the Timelines view for Leon (guy with the hat). Note that he has two stories showing up in his Current. http://imgur.com/XuN1xFn 

4. Hover over and open his story #259

5. You'll see here that there are two tests that are sub-items  (439 & 438) that are in progress and should be on the timelines view. http://imgur.com/ZgO3ntx 

So should https://sprint.ly/product/13992/#!/item/443 according to this screenshot of their Items>Underway: http://imgur.com/Huo5RL1

That all said, this doesn't always happen. In our product, you'll note that all the sub-items (#5430, #5431, #5354, #5531) assigned to Phuong are present on the timeline here http://bit.ly/H4mJGg. Even unfiltered, those subitems show up on the timeline view.
title: Sub-Items Don't Always Show Up in Timeline View
As a user, I want a permalink modal so that I can see an item's details w/o leaving the list view and losing context.
why: I can see an item's details w/o leaving the list view and losing context

description:
Every new QLer gets a chance to introduce themselves officially through this medium.

1. You'll need to write a short intro of yourself

2. Answer 9-10 [questions](https://docs.google.com/a/quickleft.com/spreadsheets/d/1IX09ysMh77pev_Mko1uod5PQz6OpqplMhJuRDtBnuhc)

3. Include a candid photo of yourself

4. When ready to post, send Amanda and Rachel a copy of your post and they will queue it up on the blog.

If you need some help getting started, I'll be more than happy to "interview" you :)

Past examples: http://quickleft.com/blog/tag/meet%20the%20team

Related to #6728
title: Kyaw: Write a "Meet the Team" blog post

parent.title: As a user, I want a new homepage so that I can learn about all the (new)features of Sprint.ly.
parent.why: I can learn about all the (new)features of Sprint.ly

description:
We did implement the fix on showing diffs on title & description edits (#5712) but I don't think we did it quite the right way because the activity stream still looks very noisy. 

We should fix it to how it was originally implemented. The description diff should be hidden behind a "view more" link that expands it when clicked.  This is true for the permalink page and we should consult with Joe on how it should appear in the activity stream. 

See #4886 for the original Story
title: Show Diffs on Titles & Descriptions

parent.title: As a pitcher, I want a beautiful pitch deck so that I can raise money for Sprint.ly.
parent.why: I can raise money for Sprint.ly

description:
Changing type between task, defect, and test is easy enough, but switching to story is harder. I think we should do this:

* Have a menu that's "Change type to ... >" that pops up a sub-menu with "Story, Test, Task, Defect" (minus the current type).
* Let them switch with a single click between task, test, defect.
* If they choose type=story for a task/test/defect we should pop up the story entry form without any of the other three tabs with the current item's title as the "what" with who/why blank. Description, tags, and assignee should be auto-filled as well.
title: As a user, I want to be able to change the type of a ticket so that I can promote tasks to stories or switch a task to a defect.
what: to be able to change the type of a ticket
why: I can promote tasks to stories or switch a task to a defect

title: Move item detail into modal

description:
From a [customer](https://sprintly.uservoice.com/admin/tickets/2731):
> when I attach an image file to a story it doesn't show up after I click Update

I confirmed by:
- editing an item using the gear icon menu
- dragging a file to the drop zone
- file processed correctly
- clicked Update
- file did not show up in activity stream
title: attaching files while adding new item or editing doesn't work
